intro: Polygonatum odoratum var. ambiguum, commonly known as the fragrant Solomon's seal, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It features slender, arching stems that bear clusters of small, greenish-white flowers with six petals. The plant produces red berries that are edible but typically not consumed by humans. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in woodland areas.
